title: 115_s2768
content: The "Veterans' Education, Transition, and Opportunity Prioritization Plan Act of 2018" is also known as the "VET OPP Act of 2018." It establishes the Veterans Economic Opportunity and Transition Administration under a new chapter in the United States Code. The "VET OPP Act of 2018" establishes the Veterans Economic Opportunity and Transition Administration within the Department of Veterans Affairs. This administration is responsible for providing assistance related to economic opportunity to veterans, their dependents, and survivors. The Under Secretary for Veterans Economic Opportunity and Transition oversees the operations of this administration. The Veterans Economic Opportunity and Transition Administration oversees various programs for veterans, including vocational rehabilitation, educational assistance, housing loans, small business verification, Transition Assistance Program, and other relevant programs determined by the Secretary. The Veterans Economic Opportunity and Transition Administration oversees programs for veterans, including vocational rehabilitation, educational assistance, housing loans, small business verification, and Transition Assistance Program. Title 38, United States Code, is amended to include a new item after chapter 79. The Veterans Economic Opportunity and Transition Administration, established under chapter 80 of title 38, United States Code, will take effect on October 1, 2019. The total number of full-time employees for fiscal years 2019 and 2020 may not exceed 21,543. An Under Secretary for Veterans Economic Opportunity and Transition will be appointed. The Under Secretary for Veterans Economic Opportunity and Transition is appointed by the President with Senate approval, based on expertise in information technology and program administration. Their responsibilities include overseeing programs within the Veterans Economic Opportunity and Transition Administration. The Under Secretary for Veterans Economic Opportunity and Transition is directly responsible to the Secretary for the operations of the Veterans Economic Opportunity and Transition Administration. Vacancies in this position prompt the Secretary to establish a commission to recommend individuals for appointment. The commission includes members representing education, training, vocational rehabilitation, employment, real estate, mortgage finance, and survivor benefits activities. The commission established by the Secretary recommends individuals for the position of Under Secretary for Veterans Economic Opportunity and Transition. Members include representatives from veterans served, private sector benefits programs, Deputy Secretary of Veterans Affairs, chairman of Veterans' Advisory Committee on Education, and former Under Secretary if deemed necessary. The commission recommends individuals for the position of Under Secretary for Veterans Economic Opportunity and Transition. Recommendations are submitted to the Secretary, who forwards them to the President and relevant committees. The President may request additional recommendations. The Assistant Secretary or Deputy Assistant Secretary of Veterans Affairs serves as the executive secretary of the commission. The table of sections in the chapter is amended to include a new item after section 306. The text amends Title 38, United States Code by redesignating subparagraphs and inserting the Under Secretary for Veterans Economic Opportunity and Transition in various sections.
